result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:37 AM Defendant Robert S Schmitz in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for C N S. Defendant eligible for SPD but has not yet been appointed counsel, requested adjournment. No objection by State.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at the the Bristled Boar Saloon in Middleton.
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards any health care worker.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

8:51 AM Defendant Robert S Schmitz in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
